properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 7:05PM EST until February 8 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Georgia...

Middle Oconee River near Athens affecting Clarke and Oconee
Counties


.Recent heavy rainfall has caused significant runoff into streams and
rivers which will cause flooding in some areas.

The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flood Warning for
The Middle Oconee River near Athens.
* From this evening until Saturday morning.
* At 6 PM Friday the stage was 17.7 feet, and rising.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 18 feet.
* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage by tonight and
continue to rise to near 18.4 feet by early Saturday morning.
The river will then fall below flood stage later Saturday morning.
* At 18 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Residential yards are flooded
in West Athens.
properties.instruction:
All persons with interests along the river should monitor the latest
forecasts...and be prepared to take necessary precautions to protect
life and property.

The latest stage data was furnished in cooperation with the United
States Geological Survey.
